attributes.action: Legislate a Less Lethal Firearms license for civilians
attributes.background:
A Less Lethal Firearms license should be legislated for civilians to purchase, possess, open carry and use PAVA Spray and/or a Taser.

This should be accompanied by a Firearms Act 2020 amendment with Section 5 exemptions for civilians with a license.
attributes.additional_details:
In the wake of increasing violent crime and strain on the Police Service, civilians with jobs such as Security Guards, Doormen, Delivery Guards and Neighbourhood Patrol groups should have a lawful right to a low risk form of OCW (Open Carry Weapon) for use in defence, escape and citizens arrests with lower casualty risks when confronted with physical violence.

Security checks and training in correct and lawful use should be mandatory before purchase and ownership of a Taser or PAVA Spray.

attributes.action: Mandatory regular lessons at school about first aid
attributes.background: Regular basic implementing first aid lesson at school, starting in primary school and in high school. Lessons have to be attended by all students, free of charge and at every school.
attributes.additional_details:
Even small children at primary can learn how to for example call an ambulance, describe symptoms, treat minor injures (put on a bandage). There was a story about a boy who call ambulance to her mother and save her life. 
I believe more lives can be saved if children learn what to do in emergency situations.

attributes.action: Give student hospital staff free parking permits
attributes.background: Many student nurses and student hospital staff reported cars being scratched, tyres let down and in some cases completely slashed when parked in residential areas due to not being able to afford parking at hospitals.

attributes.action: Introduce 'on road' Cycling to Driving lessons/Driving Test
attributes.background: Driving Test/Lessons to include 3 Hours (30 minute segments) of on road cycling for those able to do so
attributes.additional_details: Give humans the perspective to see the road from both a driving a car and riding a bicycle

attributes.action: The school testing system need to change. Student choice of exam method.
attributes.background: I believe that the school testing systems need a serious change. The main way of testing are by exam papers, but this method of testing isn’t adaptable to everyone’s specific strengths, since you could be a mathematical genius but fail your exam papers.
attributes.additional_details:
To fix this I believe we should include oral testing with an examiner, or if you prefer coursework, then you can do coursework while maintaining the capability of what you can get in A level. This would give students the opportunity to choose the testing method that best suits their capabilities. 
We need to stop limiting the creativity of our generation. We weren't made to be programmed like machines with knowledge, then check if our knowledge was retained, then continue that cycle.

attributes.action: Implement a tax on online pornography
attributes.background: Online Pornography is detrimental to young people’s brain. Many research suggests that porn negatively affects the brain so I’m calling for a tax on it as young people often opt for free sites. There is obviously a reason it’s been dubbed ‘the new drug’. Banning probably won’t work but a tax could.

attributes.action: Stop the 4 year back date of repayments for families over child benefit limits
attributes.background:
Petition question: 
"is it morally and ethically right for the government to allow HMRC to demand repayments dating 4 / 5 years previous, from families who received child benefit incorrectly when the rules around the thresholds were only made clear to these families from September 2018".
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of families including mine have just received demands of thousands of pounds from HMRC asking for all benefits paid for the past 4 or 5 years. My salary has always been below the relevant child benefit threshold but with private medical, bonus and company car, this all takes me above all thresholds. How was I to know, HMRC did not clearly advertise this. It feels like it is only when the government need to find more funds for something like the NHS do they decide to tell people so they can claim the millions back.

attributes.action: Allow objectors to appeal a planning approval decisions
attributes.background: If a local authority refuses a planning application, the applicant has the opportunity to appeal the refusal decision in which case the application is passed to the planning inspectorate for review the actions of the local authority. If the application is approved, no right of appeal exists.
attributes.additional_details: Localism allows Local Authorities to make decisions on planning applications at a local level. Applications are often approved against the advice of consultees, objectors and Parish Councils. In the case of approved applications, no similar appeal process is available to objectors. Only an extremely costly Judicial Review is available to challenge the decision and have it reviewed against local and national planning policy by a body outside of the Local Authority. This situation needs to change.

attributes.action: Increase donations to food banks by forcing schools to give away uneaten food
attributes.background: In the UK, £13,000,000 of food is thrown away daily. This is unnecessary and wasteful. There are many people who are in great need of substantial meals and schools in particular could easily reduce their environmental impact and help those in need by donating to food banks at the end of each day.

attributes.action: Make all knives sold into and throughout the U.K microchipped and to become law.
attributes.background: 3 in 4 knife crimes committed in England and Wales are unresolved. Microchipping knives in the handle AND blade will give police traceability of knives used in crimes. Discarded and or forgotten knives means that the perpetrator(s) are more likely to be caught in a quicker timeframe and convicted.
attributes.additional_details: National office of statistics 2005 to 2018. Police knife amnesty in June 2005. Police Cheif Reports.

attributes.action: Stop Physical Education (PE) from being compulsory from Year 9 to Year 11
attributes.background: We'd like to stop teenagers from having to do physical education due to them being self conscious about their outward appearance and to allow them to focus on their GCSEs.

attributes.action: Increase funding for ambulances so they reach people in time, every time.
attributes.background: The fact is that the ambulance service is under increasing strain. Ambulance staff are working incredibly hard with inadequate funding. This is not acceptable. Sign this petition to force the government to debate this issue that affects everyone.

attributes.action: The School Week Should Start On A Tuesday and End On Friday.
attributes.background: Many people may need that additional rest from school whether they're a student or the teacher.

attributes.action: Stop the process of the European Union (Withdrawal) (No. 3) Bill 2017-19.
attributes.background: A Bill currently on the second reading stage in Parliament has been set out to force the government to seek an extenstion on Article 50, if a deal is not agreed in Parliament. I believe that this will not help things with brexit causing a lot more devision accross the country.
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see this Bill scrapped in the House of Commons as this hinders the vote of the British people.

attributes.action: I want disability education to become a mandatory lesson in all schools.
attributes.background: I suffer with cerebral palsy as a result of complications during birth and having witnessed several incidents in which people are subject to abuse because they seem like normal people but they have to use a wheelchair for certain situations.

attributes.action: Hold a new Brexit referendum at the next General Election if UK has not left EU
attributes.background: In the event that the UK has not yet left the EU by the time that the next General  Election is called, a new referendum on U.K. membership of the European Union (Brexit) should be held. Voting should take place at the same time as choosing a Member of Parliament, but with a separate ballot.
attributes.additional_details:
Brexit negotiations are causing instability in Parliament. The chances of a leadership challenge, or a vote of no confidence, are high. This could trigger a General Election.

If the British public are to be subjected to yet another General Election before we have formally left the EU, the opportunity should be taken to run a new, better “Brexit” referendum.

This will stop campaigning, and the outcome of an election, being misrepresented as a Brexit mandate, when it is in fact a vote for an MP.

attributes.action: Require the NHS to notify patients whose test results are at risk of delay
attributes.background: There is currently no system in place to notify patients if their results are caught up in a backlog, and from a personal point of view this can lead to great stress and anxiety.
attributes.additional_details:
It should be part of law/the NHS Constitution to notify patients of notable delays as this can cause distress.
 
According to "Standards for the communication of patient diagnostic test results on discharge from hospital" (NHS England, March 2016), the stress and anxiety on a patient in the delay of the results has been acknowledged, and they claimed "reviews" were being carried out.

attributes.action: Affirm that a ban on smacking children will not be enacted in England
attributes.background:
The Scottish Parliament is in the process of introducing a ban on parents smacking their children.

This could influence Parliament to introduce a nationwide ban. 

Parliament must affirm that it will not restrict parents' rights to decide how to raise their children.
attributes.additional_details:
Assaulting your child is already illegal. A ban on smacking will not prevent bad parents beating their children, it will merely criminalise good parents trying to discipline their kids. 

It would also open the floodgates: will sending a child to their room be false imprisonment? Will taking away their toy be theft? 

Children need discipline and it is for parents, not the State, to decide how to do it. A ban would be unacceptable interference in parents' rights to a family life.

attributes.action: Offer free DNA paternity tests after birth as the standard NHS procedure.
attributes.background: Approximately 20% of the men in the UK who get a paternity test turn out not to be fathers of their alleged children. A paternity DNA check should be offered for free at birth. It should also be offered if a mother claims that someone is the father after some time passes since the birth.
attributes.additional_details: Nowadays it is easy, fast and cheap to make a DNA paternity test. If the paternity test results with a negative result, the man should have a choice to avoid any legal/financial responsibility and owe no alimonies whatsoever, unless he consciously chooses to accept the child as his own (whilst being fully aware that it was conceived by someone else).

attributes.action: Reform law to safeguard public interests ensuring against abuse of police power
attributes.background: We need a full review of police powers to recommend ways to reform the police. The review must cover whether the police target innocent people and act to avoid accountability. It must look for illegality, irrationality, impropriety in procedures, and failure to abide by rules of natural justice.
attributes.additional_details: The police can target innocent people on the street or at home by saying that a crime was reported, intelligence was received, or they said or did something that looked suspicious. To protect the public from abuse of police powers, the review must consider whether the police must be made to provide within 14 days evidence to the individual/s of why that person was stopped, questioned or visited by the police and whether the police should have to apply to the court if they want to withhold any records/evidence.

attributes.action: Mandatory minimum sentence for shaken baby deaths no guilty plea reduction.
attributes.background: We are calling for a mandatory minimum sentence of 15 years when an offender kills a child through shaking the infant. This should also mean that they are not eligible for the reduction in sentence when pleading guilty to get a lower jail term.
attributes.additional_details: The case of Lee Sweet who pled guilty to manslaughter of his son should serve as a warning that this should never happen again. No family should have to wait a year to lay to rest such a precious life, let alone have to watch as he received a third reduction in sentence for pleading guilty after 11 months of denying it.

attributes.action: Declassify first class carriages on all rush hour trains
attributes.background: Given the rising cost of train travel, it’s utterly unacceptable that hard-working commuters aren’t guaranteed a seat. Declassifying first class carriages can at least alleviate the issue. It is archaic, and totally unjustifiable when commuters are literally falling over each other in standard class

attributes.action: M1 motorway must go beyond Berwick upon Tweed
attributes.background: As we now have the M6 motorway on the west coast, going all the way up to the Anglo-Scottish border (i.e. Gretna Green) and then connecting the M74 motorway on the other side of the border, we could now do with having a motorway that goes over the border on the east coast too.
attributes.additional_details: That's why I urge the government to extend the M1 up to Scotland on the east coast as well.  It would mean people travelling from London to Edinburgh or vice-versa would be able to travel not only quicker, but would also reduce traffic on our roads.

attributes.action: Revive the Black Arrow rocket program to put the UK back into space.
attributes.background: From 1969-71, the UK launched a rocket named Black Arrow. The program was a success, but was unfortunately cancelled due to cost issues. Now with new technology and cheaper launch costs, it would be great to see this program revived to provide an alternative launch platform for sattelite companies.
attributes.additional_details: The Black Arrow saw four launches, with one placing the sattelite Prospero into an orbit around the earth. While the rocket saw two launch failures, it eventually ended up succeeding. Unfortunately, the program was cancelled in favour of using the cheaper US rockets to launch sattelites. With the growth of the space industry, and the advent of Brexit, a UK space program is needed. An updated version of Black Arrow will provide a cheaper alternative to the Ariane or Proton rockets used by Europe.

attributes.action: Enable the means to choose whether internet linked activities can be recorded.
attributes.background: I wish a simple, obvious setting to be shown on all devices used to connect to the internet to enable or prevent the harvesting of all data generated from any use of the internet unless required by law. It should be readily accessible to be turned on or off and take immediate effect.
attributes.additional_details: When Google updated it's Terms of Service, I checked what Google had recorded. It had recorded every search I had performed. Worse, the companies I had searched within, sent that data to Google. E.G. if within another company's web-site you click on a Google map, details go to Google. It goes much further. If I use my Android smart phone to take a picture, the software notifies Google! Anything Android processes goes to Google, payments, hotel bookings etc, they get to know everything - why?

attributes.action: Make the sale age of Tobacco 21
attributes.background:
Increasing the sale age to 21 would decrease the use of tobacco nationwide. 

But ultimately the main goal is to be the first country to ban the sale altogether.
attributes.additional_details:
Alongside increasing the sale age to 21 this would decrease the use of tobacco use,  making steps towards the ultimate goal of banning the sale of tobacco altogether, the UK would make the first country to band the sale of a Dangerous cancer killing drug 

The idea that everyone knows how much it kills is the strangest part about it and as a country we need to me the first move.

attributes.action: Update food allergies laws to list allergens on menus in food establishments
attributes.background: In 2014, food allergies laws were passed for food establishments to tell customers if their food contains ingredients known to trigger allergies. It has recently become apparent staff don't always provide the correct information. An update is needed to make it compulsory for the info to be on menus

attributes.action: Nationalise UK mobile telephone masts.
attributes.background: 6 December 2018, O2 experienced a widespread failure affecting 20m+ UK customers. However other network providers continued to enjoy access. This petition would bring into public hands the network of phone masts, thus guaranteeing equality of access for customers.
attributes.additional_details:
Mobile data access is a key part of working and personal life for almost all people in the UK today. 

To have access for some and not for others when a network goes down is depriving large segments of the population with the ability to be productive, happy, and even safe.

It does not need to be this way, if the hardware of UK mobile data coverage was recognised as a natural monopoly and brought into public hands so it could also be managed in the public interest, all would be better off.

attributes.action: Change student loan arrangements to reflect career success
attributes.background:
The current arrangements reduce the incentive for students to achieve high-earning roles. Successful students see their debt increase every year until they are earning 4 x the average salary. 
Lower earners may never repay anything. This situation cannot be justified.
attributes.additional_details: The interest on the debt should be fixed at the no more than half a percent above the Bank of England rate when the loan is issued. Repayment should then be taken from all earnings/income (with no lower limit) at a rate that would pay the interest charges and reduce the outstanding balance. If students never work then the loan should be collected by a small reduction in any benefits.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of possible depo provera injection side effects
attributes.background: Depo provera injection for birth control and to stop periods I chose this was right treatment for myself only to of met my partner and us decide we want to try for a baby well as we looked deeply on the internet to see what side effects I would well what we found out was really bad and shocking.
attributes.additional_details: The mood swings, irregular periods, and potentially getting bone loss density which some women have through this the reading just shocked me if I had done more research 4+ years ago I would of never of had it. I think this injection should come with a warning label or taken off the market our nurses and doctors just don't know enough and should be well trained in this.

attributes.action: The UK legal definition of rape should change to the US version.
attributes.background: The UK law means only penetration with a penis is considered rape. Instead, the US version should be used. This covers all forms of forced penetration. Penetration from an object can cause the same trauma as when penetrated by a penis, yet these victims attackers can get off more lightly.
attributes.additional_details:
UK DEFINITION

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/42/part/1/crossheading/rape

Definition of rape - ( This version means only men can be charged and only when using their penis. )

"he intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person (B) with his penis,
(b)B does not consent to the penetration, and
(c)A does not reasonably believe that B consents."


US DEFINITION 

https://www.justice.gov/archives/opa/blog/updated-definition-rape

Definition of rape - 

“The penetration, no matter how slight, of the vagina or anus with any body part or object, or oral penetration by a sex organ of another person, without the consent of the victim.”

attributes.action: Allow 3 wheeled vehicles to be driven on a car licence at 17
attributes.background: In 2013 the law was changed so that 3 wheeled vehicles could not be driven on any licence until the person is 21 i can sort off understand this for motorcycle licences but not car licences

attributes.action: legally require a receipt to be printed only if a customer actually wants one
attributes.background: Many large companies automatically print receipts for customers after small transactions (namely fast food shops and brands offering a self service experience). Customers often do not take these receipts. This is an incredible waste of paper that is not justifiable and can be easily avoided.

attributes.action: Change House of Commons rules so MPs can call each other by their names
attributes.background: Enough is enough, we the people demand this reform in the houses of parliament.

attributes.action: Inspect and license all breeders of horses and ponies to prevent suffering
attributes.background: The government must introduce and enforce inspection and licensing of breeders to prevent cruel exploitative breeding of poor quality horses and ponies. The licensing fee will pay for the enforcement. Please lobby your MP and Michael Gove Minister for DEFRA responsible for horse welfare.

attributes.action: Make cat calling an illegal act in the UK
attributes.background:
Cat calling refers to the act of shouting harassing and often sexually suggestive, threatening, or derisive comments at someone publicly. 

Surveys have found that 85% of people under 40 years old have taken a different route home to avoid harassment. Cat Calling should not have this power.
attributes.additional_details:
End Violence Against Women Coalition commissioned YouGov to conduct the first national poll on street harassment in 2016. The poll found that 64% of women of all ages have experienced unwanted sexual harassment in public places.

There are laws in the UK which focus on sexual misconduct but none specifically related to catcalling. This is not an impossible task with countries like Portugal, Belgium and France having already implemented such laws.

attributes.action: Pass the Restroom Access Act 2005 (Ally's Law) in the UK
attributes.background: The Restroom Access Act 2005 is an act in the USA that requires establishments that have toilet facilities for their employees to also allow customers to use the facilities if the customer suffers from an inflammatory bowel disease or other medical conditon requiring immediate access to a toilet.
attributes.additional_details: There is not enough awareness of IBD in the UK, hopefully signing this petition will help bring out this awareness and pass the Act.

attributes.action: Bring in minimum standards for certain camping equipment sold in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a huge amount of camping equipment abandoned at festivals every year which is bad for the environment. Much of the equipment is of a poor standard and inadequate for the British summer leading to many people getting cold and wet to the extent that they need medical help.
attributes.additional_details:
Minimum standards should be -
Tents must have an inner and outer skin and a minimum Hydrostatic Head rating of 3000. (Small play tents can be exempt.)
Any sleeping bag rated as suitable only for temperatures over 5 degrees centigrade should be clearly labelled "UK Indoors Only".
Roll mats must have a minimum thickness when compressed. 
All folding chairs and stools must have their maximum weight clearly displayed in kilogrammes and stones and pounds, in large letters on the sales label.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health First Aid a compulsory element of teacher training.
attributes.background: I'm Ben, I've set up this petition as part of a teenage mental health awareness campaign started after my brother, Sam West, tragically committed suicide aged 15 in January 2018. Your signature won't bring my brother back, but it could save someone else's life and that's all I want.
attributes.additional_details: Some teachers, who will remain anonymous, have reacted positively to the idea when it was put past them stating that teachers often won't act at all as they don't have the knowledge or confidence to deal with the situation. A compulsory course will provide the confidence to at least approach a student about their mental wellbeing and start working on a solution. This vital next move, which is cheaper than alternatives, can combat the ever-escalating problem which is teenage mental health.

attributes.action: Keep the tornado in a flying order
attributes.background: The Panavia  tornado has been flying for many years for the golf war and has saved many lives so at least we can do is give a preservation of flying order to it this means to keep it in flying so it won't be scrapped and forgot we have done the same for ww2 aircraft let's do it for the future
attributes.additional_details:
Gulf war - 1991
Kosovo war 
Bosnian war
Iraq war
Libyan Civil war

Also involved with 
Yemen
 afganistan
 Syria

attributes.action: Create a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children
attributes.background: Introduce a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children. I propose a small tax on all goods sold in England. The tax money will buy food for starving African children. Food security is very important, because when people have no money or food, eventually wars happen.
attributes.additional_details: Overall, 5.6 million children under age five died in 2016, nearly 15,000 daily. The risk of a child dying before five years of age is highest in Africa - about 8 times higher than in Europe. Eventually if other countries from around the world put a tax on their goods too, this international tax money would help collapsed economies from around the world, so it would be like a world social security ensuring the world to be a safer world to live in for everyone.

attributes.action: Support a Referendum to abolish compulsory BBC licence fee
attributes.background: In this age of fair competition the BBC should not be able to unfairly demand a yearly licence payment from the general public without giving the people the choice of having or not having the BBC channels, this is an outdated and unfair monopoly.
attributes.additional_details:
No other media company gets a compulsory payment from the uk general public.
You can choose to have Virgin,Sky etc You have no choice when it comes to the BBC

attributes.action: You should only be able to take a maximum of five driving tests.
attributes.background: You should only be able to attempt a maximum of five driving tests as to take more than five would be a fluke pass, this would reduce the number of vehicle's on the road easing congestion and would also be a massive improvement for the environment cutting pollution massively.

attributes.action: More funding for mental health awareness
attributes.background: There is not enough funding for mental health awareness. People know too little about it. It should be spoken about more freely, so we don't have to feel isolated and different from everyone else. We are not weird or strange, we are the same just with a different thinking process.

attributes.action: Give every house free solar panels so we can burn less fossil fuels
attributes.background: If every house gets a solar panel for free they will stop buying electricity and use the free electricity coming from the panel. This can help the environment and reduce climate change

attributes.action: Increase Maternity Leave up to 2 years .
attributes.background: Let stay mums with babies longer. Its a so painful to leave 6 month old baby already with a family member or childminder when he or she needs mums warm and cuddles most.

attributes.action: Removing extra £310 vehicle tax on cars over £40000.
attributes.background: My petition is to remove the unjustified road tax for cars over £40000. Vehicle tax is depends on engine size and CO2 emissions, which is fair enough. But paying extra £ 310 for cars over £40000 up to five years is totally baseless and unfair to car owners.
attributes.additional_details: Pay extra £ 310 along with road tax up to five years and after five years pay normal road tax. WHY AND FOR WHAT DO WE PAY EXTRA £310 for five years. Is this a kind of punishment to buy little extra luxury in life after all hard work and pay humongous income tax genuinely?

attributes.action: Legalise hare coursing
attributes.background: Hare coursing is a traditional sport and was made illegal. However banning it has led to an increase in offences such as poaching. If it were to be made legal again it would be much more convenient to farmers, police and all others.

attributes.action: GCSE Maths, English and Science should be optional from year 10
attributes.background: Many GCSE students will find the knowledge either difficult or pointless as there is so much to remember on top of the pressure from other subjects. Also other students may get bored and distract those who do want to take the subject in future potentially causing them to achieve lower.

attributes.action: Raise the legal smoking age to 19 in 2019, then raise it by 1 year annually
attributes.background: Set the legal smoking age to 19 in 2019, 20 in 2020, and raise it by one year annually. This way, the limit will always be the current year, making it easy to remember. No one would find themselves banned if they already smoke. However, anyone currently under 19 would be prevented from taking it up.
attributes.additional_details:
The minimum age at which you can buy cigarettes in the UK is at present 18.

In 2016/17 there were estimated to be 484,700 hospital admissions attributable to smoking (Hospital Episode Statistics), and in 2016 there were estimated to be 77,900 deaths attributable to smoking in the UK (Office for National Statistics).

Tobacco smoking destroys lives and families, while megacorporations haul their massive profits to the bank. If you believe it should be phased out, please lend your support to this petition.
